comments.text:
Do you happen to have Adblock Plus installed?

That's the extension causing it here. If not try in firefox safe mode[1] and see if you can reproduce it there.

[1] http://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_Mode

comments.text:
The screen expanding and contracting behavior can be reproduced following the below steps

STR:
1.Go to URL
2.Perform any changes to firefox(i.e., minimize & maximize, or activate menu bar by using keyboard shortcuts)

This happens in safe mode and new profile

cork@box.qzdev.se
comments.text:
I had totally forgotten this bug.

Looking closer, its correct abp doesn't trigger it. A reload of the page stops the behavior.

What happens is that the js calculates wrong for the width of the option blocks at the bottom (Shift/Job Type...). I haven't looked close enough to see if its the code assuming things or if firefox calculates things wrong.

I've tracked it down to the for loop in view-source:https://appliedmat.taleo.net/careersection/750PRD.19.8.1.3.0/js/ftlallc.js at line 1198-1212, or line 1202 to be exact.
comments.raw_text:
I had totally forgotten this bug.

Looking closer, its correct abp doesn't trigger it. A reload of the page stops the behavior.

What happens is that the js calculates wrong for the width of the option blocks at the bottom (Shift/Job Type...). I haven't looked close enough to see if its the code assuming things or if firefox calculates things wrong.

I've tracked it down to the for loop in view-source:https://appliedmat.taleo.net/careersection/750PRD.19.8.1.3.0/js/ftlallc.js at line 1198-1212, or line 1202 to be exact.
